content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

ordinance

Related words are:

- law
- regulation
- ordination

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

content.thinking:
I need to describe the word "ordinance" without using "ordinance" itself or any of the related words: "law", "regulation", or "ordination".

An ordinance is typically a rule or order made by a local government or authority that has the force of law within a specific jurisdiction. It's similar to legislation but usually at a municipal level.

Let me think of ways to describe it without using those forbidden words:
- A local government's official command or directive
- A municipal rule that citizens must follow
- A city council's formal decision that becomes binding
- An official decree issued by local authorities
- A city's version of rules passed by council members

I need to make sure my clue is clear but doesn't use any of the forbidden words or parts of "ordinance" (like "ordain" or similar roots).

My clue should be short and to the point since there's time pressure. I'll focus on the local government aspect and the fact that it's a binding directive.

Final clue: A city council's formal ruling that citizens must obey

content.text: CLUE: A formal rule created by a local government, like a city council, that citizens must follow.

clem_player.response: CLUE: A formal rule created by a local government, like a city council, that citizens must follow.

content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: A formal rule created by a local government, like a city council, that citizens must follow.

content.thinking:
The clue is: "A formal rule created by a local government, like a city council, that citizens must follow."

This sounds like it's describing a law or regulation at the local government level. Some possible words that match this description:
- Ordinance
- Bylaw
- Regulation
- Code
- Statute
- Law
- Rule
- Mandate
- Resolution
- Decree

Among these, the most specific term for a rule created by a local government like a city council would be "ordinance" or "bylaw". These are specifically laws passed by municipal or local governments.

Since I need to make my first guess, I'll go with "ordinance" as it seems to be the most precise match for the description.

content.text:
I need to guess a word that matches: "A formal rule created by a local government, like a city council, that citizens must follow."

This sounds like a local law or regulation created by municipal governments. Based on this description, my first guess is:

GUESS: ordinance
